page.title: 04THE FOSSE WAY
page.content: The main road running through our area is the A37,the Roman Road from Exeter to Lincoln.The road runs straight in a S.W-N.E direction, & has declined in importance since the building of the M5 motorway.However surveys taken in 1982 and 1984 show a slight increase in trafic use from 5450 to 5500 daily average total flow in both directions in a 16 hour day; and use by vehicals of 1500 kilograms and over (unladen) has increased from 570 to 630 for the same period The only facilities for refreshment along the road are a pub and a restaurant.The Fosseway Stall is manned and supplied by local villagers during July and August weekends,in aid of church funds.The only public transport is a daily National bus with no scheduled stop.
